org.jgentleframework.services.objectpooling.context
Interface Validate

All Known Subinterfaces:
Poolable
public interface Validate

The implementation of validate() method is a useful method to ensure that the pool always returns instances that are in a valid state.

Author:
Quoc Chung - mailto: skydunkpro@yahoo.com
See Also:
CanBePooled, Deactivate

Method Summary
 boolean validate()
          Ensures that the instance is safe to be returned by the pool.
 

Method Detail

validate

boolean validate()
Ensures that the instance is safe to be returned by the pool. Returns false if object should be destroyed.

Parameters:
obj - the instance to be validated
Returns:
false if obj is not valid and should be dropped from the pool, true otherwise.
